intro: Aster fanjingshanicus, commonly known as the Fanjingshan aster, is a flowering plant native to China, specifically the Fanjingshan mountain range. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at higher elevations, showcasing its adaptability to mountainous climates. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disk, contributing to its ornamental value. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
